result.title: ROCKWELL AUTOMATION TO ADVANCE INDUSTRIAL INTELLIGENCE THROUGH EDGE-BASED GENERATIVE AI WITH NVIDIA NEMOTRON
result.text: Purpose-built AI model delivers instant insights and control for industrial teams, on the edge, offline and everywhere work happens MILWAUKEE , Nov. 13, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Rockwell Automation, Inc. (NYSE: ROK), one of the world's largest companies dedicated to industrial automation and digital transformation, today announced a breakthrough in bringing generative AI directly to the industrial edge. Rockwell is introducing its integration of NVIDIA Nemotron Nano, a purpose-built small language model (SLM) optimized for FactoryTalk Design Studio and other Rockwell product workflows, marking a major step in real-time intelligence for industrial teams.

result.title: Rockwell Automation Introduces SecureOT Solution Suite to Strengthen Industrial Cybersecurity Resilience
result.text: OT-designed platform and security services empower industrial organizations to reduce risk, maximize uptime and simplify compliance across the full cybersecurity lifecycle MILWAUKEE , Nov. 12, 2025 /PRNewswire/ --Rockwell Automation, Inc. (NYSE: ROK), the world's largest company dedicated to industrial automation and digital transformation, today announced the launch of SecureOT solution suite, a comprehensive industrial cybersecurity offering designed to help manufacturers and critical infrastructure protect critical operations and build secure environments. As industrial operations become increasingly connected, organizations are facing a sharp rise in cyber threats targeting operations technology (OT) systems.

result.title: Rockwell Automation: Looking At Q4 And The Company's Appeal
result.text: Rockwell Automation, Inc. remains a high-quality automation leader with strong North American market share and robust partnerships in AI and cloud. Despite impressive organic growth and superior margins, ROK's valuation is stretched at 35x P/E, well above historical and peer averages. The cyclical nature of ROK's business and a sub-2% dividend yield limit its appeal at current prices, especially given recent management changes.
